name: The St. Regis Florence

reviews.text: We stayed there for a short winter break and had an excellent stay. They upgraded us (family with 9-year old) to a "Junior Suite" which worked out fine. We could see the duomo from our window.
reviews.title: Excellent Old World Splendour
the best beds in Italy!
reviews.text: Comfortable room, well maintained. Friendly staff. Good price.

reviews.title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in
reviews.text: Excellent included breakfast, which is unusual for an Italian hotel, but get a capuccino/espresso rather than the coffee in a pot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's slightly out of the centre, being close to the train station, but not more than a few minutes walk from all the sights.
reviews.title: Renaissance Suite 420

likes.liked: — Renaissance frescoes, view of the Arno from the Balcony, Breakfast quaity and choice.
likes.disliked: — Noise from the traffic bridge, hard beds and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gorgeous room in a lovely well located hotel. On the river and within easy walking distance of all the bridges. The beds and linens were the most luxurious and most comfortable that we encountered in our 14 days in Italy. Loved the breakfast buffets too.
reviews.title: Tutto Bene!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was by far our favorite one in Italy. We had an AMAZING room overlooking the Arno. It was plush and decorated like a bedroom in a castle with "frescoes" on the walls and a huge canopy bed fit for a king and queen. It was huge and the bed was so comfortable. The staff at the front desk was always smiling and ready to help. We used the concierge numerous times and they always steered us in the right direction from restaurant choices to a private driver/guide to Siena and different wineries and another guide to give us a private three hour tour of Florence. Their own restaurant had a fabulous breakfast buffet and they were so willing to make our meal enjoyable. The outside "patio" restaurant had an amazing sandwich and good cocktails. Overall, one word....amazing.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing hotel stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay here. The location was excellent. We had a lunch and dinner in the restaurant and they were both among the best we had in Italy. There was a duo singing at dinner which was very nice. Service throughout hotel was lovely and helpful. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay excellent service

reviews.text: This hotel is absolutely beautiful, and located right across the street from the river with all the gorgeous bridges. It is very conveniently located. We walked to every major site in the city. The "Winter Garden Lobby" is truly spectacular with it's stained glass ceiling arched corridors with marble columns and piped in music. It's perfect for a night cap before turning in for the evening. There are only a couple of negative things about this hotel. First, the person who checks you in walks you to your room does nothing else and expects a tip, then comes your luggage and he needs to be tipped. Only 2 people are allowed/room. We took our daughter for her senior trip and we had to rent another entire room because they didn't allow rollaway beds even though our room was huge. The other thing that was irritating was that irons were not allowed in these 5-star rooms. You had to send your pants out to be pressed at a fee of 8.50 Euro. But get ready, everything in Europe is outrageous. We were grossly dissappointed in the food all over Italy. We thought we were going to have some phenominal Italian food. Instead we starved! The food was flavorless, minimal in portion, and outrageously expensive. We have a family friend who is doing a study abroad program in Florence and he has lost 15 pounds and can hardly wait for a good meal back home. Once we got to Rome we finally found a Hard Rock Cafe and ate there every day. The only decent meal we had in all of Italy was in Florence at the La Giostra. It's run by real live Austrian royalty and even though it wasn't as flavorful as "us Texans" prefer, it was very good
reviews.title: The Beautiful Grand-Florence

likes.disliked: — No irons and the irritating check in clerk who walked you to your room and expected a tip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel via SPG, and upon check-in were upgraded to a beautiful suite. They had it in their system that it was our honeymoon, and a bottle of champagne, roses, and a congratulatory note from the manager were sent up to our room shortly after we were unpacked.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon Hotel

likes.liked: — Everything. The people and location were perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location and hospitality of this hotel was really second to none. The staff really went out of their way to be as helpful as possible, and it was hard not to feel like royalty while staying there.
reviews.title: Lovely room, great service, fine location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Hotel Florence truly is a grand hotel as others have noted. My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights in Oct., 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: A truly Grand hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and elegantly appointed. The bath was huge, the dressing area and entry hall a decided plus. Neither noise nor light were a problem - sleeping on the fantastic canopied bed was really a dream.
reviews.title: A Real Gem

likes.liked: — Hotel service, location, size of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts in the wonderful winter garden were outstanding and the entire staff - bellmen, doormen, housekeeping, reception and the wonderful concierge desk - were not only helpful and cheerful, but seemed to constantly try to find ways to increase our enjoyment of our stay.
reviews.title: Loved the luxurious little extras

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is so perfect that the only time we needed a ride was to and from the airport - all of the museums and attractions of Florence are within a short walking distance, loads of fine restaurants (ristorente, trattorias, osterias, pizzarias, pasticceruas, etc.) all with a few minutes stroll, yet never a crowd on the piazza Ognascenti in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Pleasant, if overpriced, Grand Hotel

reviews.text: One of my finest hotel stays of the past 50 years!
reviews.title: Mislead and deceived

likes.liked: — Very large and interestingly furnished...old florentine decor
likes.disliked: — extremely dusty velvet curtains and bedhangings, dreary bathroom and terrible balcony

reviews.title: Luxury at a Price
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sheraton Grand Hotel in Florence for 3 nights in March 2007 using Starwood points; otherwise, we would not have been able to afford the room. I am not sure what I reserved but our room was at a top floor with two balconies overlooking the Arno and the areas behind it. We couldn't have stayed in a more beautiful setting.

Everything about the hotel was gorgeous. Our room was spacious with ornate details and materials. The marble bathroom was awesome. I could sit on the toilet in the morning and watch the sun bathe the hills in light through the balcony; it made the experience surreal until my girlfriend knocked on the door and tells me to hurry my [-] up. Hahaha!!!
reviews.title: Good Choice for florence

reviews.text: We woke up each morning relaxed and ready to go. The bed was Starwood comfy (they always have nice beds), and we were able to close the curtains and shut out any lights from the outside.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Right on The Arno

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only drawback was the ridiculous buffet breakfast -- 35 euros per person. Ouch! We ended up doing as the Florentines do and grabbed our cappucinos (1.50 euros each and we each needed two cups every morning), croissants and pastry from around the corner for a fraction of the cost.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Europe!

reviews.text: We certainly got what we paid for. The location was great. There is a Westin across the piazza, but in my opinion, this hotel and especially if you can get a room on the Arno side is a better choice.
reviews.title: Beautiful views of the Arno River

description: Located in a sumptuous palace in the heart of the city, The St. RegisFlorence is a privileged base from which to experience Tuscany'stimeless attractions. A short stroll will bring you to the iconic Uffizi,Duomo or Ponte Vecchio’s elegant jewelry shops. Legendary for its history, Florence’s streets offer inimitable treasures.The St. Regis Florence offers 19 exquisite suites enriched with refinedfurniture and antique artworks, together with 81 elegant guestroomsdecorated with the prestigious Medici, Fiorentino and Renaissancestyles.
